msDesc.head: Bandinus, Commentary on Sentences of Peter Lombard, etc. Italy, s. xiiex.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1227–1233. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Magister Bandinus
msItem.title: Commentary on Peter Lombard, Sentences
msItem.note: Sententiarum libri iv (a compendium to Peter Lombard’s Sententiae) (ed.: PL 192. 971A–1112B; Little 39, citing the present MS. only; Stegmüller, RS, 94, citing the present MS. (incorrect folio no.), and suppl.; Landgraf, Einführung, 96, this copy; Bloomfield 800 (‘Hildegundus or Magister Bacidinus, Compendium de rebus divinas’).
(fol. 74r) a note on sepulture during the Holy Week.

msItem.title: De tribus Mariis
msItem.note: (fol. 75r) Extract from Hildebert of Lavardin, Carmina minora (eight hexameters), followed by geneology of St Anne and three Mariae.

msItem.author: Peter Damian
msItem.title: Epistolae (epp. 92-3, De quindecim signis diem iudicii praecedentibus)
msItem.note: Ed.: K. Reindel, Die Briefe des Petrus Damiani Teil 3, MGH Die Briefe der deutschen Kaiserzeit 4,3 (Munich, 1989) 21, l. 4–23 (ep. 92) & 30, ll. 5–36 (ep. 93); Gerhardt & Palmer, Fünfzehn Zeichen, 62, etc. – BHM 654; C. Lohmer, ‘Endzeiterwartung bei Petrus Damiani: Überlegungen zu seinen Briefen Nr. 92 und 93’, in Regensburg, Bayern und Europa. Festschrift für Kurt Reindel zum 70. Geburtstag, eds L. Kolmer & P. Segl (Regensburg, 1995) 175–87; Gerhardt & Palmer, Fünfzehn Zeichen, 61–63).

msItem.title: Verse (computus)
msItem.note: Memorial verses: Easter day text for the years 1140–1212 (ed. B. Bischoff, ‘Ostertagtexte und Intervalltafeln’, in his Mittelalterliche Studien 2, 192–227, at pp. 218f. (12 1/2 verses); cf. also p. 198; Walther, IC, 7310, ‘De ciclo decemnovennali’, citing the present MS. (incorrect date and folio no.)).

msItem.author: Hildebert of Lavardin
msItem.title: De mysterio missae
msItem.note: Extract of seven hexameters (De mutatione locorum in missa) (ed.: PL 171. 1192C or 1194A & B respectively (v. 1–5) & 1194A (v. 6–7); Walther, IC, 5831, citing the present MS. (incorrect date: s. xiv)).

msItem.title: Old Testament
msItem.note: Quotations from I Samuel (I Kings) 15-31, II Samuel (II Kings) 3, and Proverbs 1-14.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fols 30, 53 & 62) Bookmarks, to each book: blue-coloured thread, horizontally sewn into the outer margin.
supportDesc.foliation: i, ii, 1–79, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. Medieval foliation in roman numerals, together with ‘f.’ (folio), in upper right-hand margins.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling (fols 1r–74r, l. 4) in hard point, one column of 29 or 30 lines. Ruled space c.135–138 76–80

handDesc.handNote: main text (item 1): late protogothic script, Italy, s. xiiex, by a single hand, above top line. Marginalia and corrections added by scribe and contemporary hands. Headers, in a hand of s. xivex or s. xv, which also added foliation. (Items 2–6) Each item in a different, contemporary or younger hand (hands 2–6).

decoDesc.decoNote: Penwork initials in red, blue and gold.

binding.p: Limp parchment case binding for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the lower margin of fol. 1r: ‘Liber carthusiensium moguncie’.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. ii verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Decoration, localization and date follow Pächt and Alexander (1970). Quarto Catalogue, col. 345 Quarto Catalogue, p. 564 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 50
